intro: Packera tampicana, commonly known as the Tampicane fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It produces small, yellowish to white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Packera tampicana is often found in areas with disturbed soil and is adapted to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
